title: Cybersecurity scam of the week: Amazon Prime Phishing
description: Cybercriminals are exploiting Amazon Prime memberships by sending fake renewal emails. These emails contain a link to a PDF file, which then redirects to a fraudulent Amazon login page. The page looks genuine but is designed to steal login credentials, credit card details, and personal information.How to Stay Protected:Avoid opening unexpected attachments or clicking links in suspicious emails.Check your Amazon Prime status by visiting the official website or mobile app directly.Be cautious of emails creating urgency or requesting sensitive information. When in doubt, contact Amazon through their official customer support.Stay alert and protect your personal and financial information!

title: Center for Brain and Health (CBH) Seminar Series | Dr Brian Murphy
description: Title of the Event:Understanding Symptoms and Mechanisms of Brain Aging and Mental Health at ScaleSpeaker:Dr. Brian Murphy- Chief Scientific Officer, Founder, Cumulus NeuroscienceDay/Date:Tuesday,February 18, 2025Time:2 PM – 3:15 PMVenue:A2 - First Floor - Room 127Abstract:When assessing neurology and psychiatry patients in clinical care and research, we often choose between advanced tools found in specialist clinics or scalable, imprecise tools. Ideally, we’d track symptoms and mechanisms with more fidelity, but real-world settings like homes and small clinics pose challenges. Brian will discuss the strengths and limitations of assessment tools, from self-report questionnaires to clinic-based neuroimaging, and how repeated sampling, large datasets, and machine learning can help. Brian will illustrate this with data from home-based Alzheimer’s Disease studies and clinical trials. Early findings from international dementia screening studies will also be presented.

title: Cybersecurity scam of the week: Wildfire Relief Scams
description: Following recent wildfires in California, cybercriminals are exploiting disaster victims by impersonating federal officers and offering fake relief aid. These scams are spreading through emails, phone calls, and even in-person visits.Scammers claim financial aid is available but demand upfront fees and request personal information like Social Security numbers. Victims who comply lose money and risk identity theft, with no actual aid in return.Tips to Protect Yourself:Avoid paying fees for disaster relief.Verify information on official government websites before taking action.Be cautious of unsolicited messages or visits offering financial aid, especially if they request personal details.Stay alert and protect against disaster-related scams!

description: The inaugural House of Artisans Design Competition is now open for submissions! title: Participate in brain imaging research!
description: ASPIRE Precision Medicine Research Institute Abu Dhabi invites you to participate in a MRI study here at NYUAD! The institute’s mission is to gain a better understanding of conditions prevalent in the region.For the first session, we will first collect demographic data and vision tests. Then, we will collect a series of brain scans in the MRI scanner. Finally, we will collect a saliva sample. The study will take approximately 2 hours to complete. The second session will consist of a 1 hour OCT scan and virtual reality vision tests. You will be compensated with vouchers worth 180 AED.You are eligible to participate if you are above 18 years of age, do not have a history of neurological conditions, are not pregnant at the time of the study, and do not have non-removable metal.If you are interested please email one of the researchers below:Last names A-M contact Aysha Hamkari:aah698@nyu.eduLast names N-Z contact Dana Alkalali:dna8993@nyu.edu

title: Language Matters Speaker Series on Translanguaging
description: Join us for the first webinar this semester on language pedagogy on Monday, Feb. 24, at 5pm via Zoom."Beyond Boundaries: Pedagogical Translanguaging and the Transformation of Language Learning" by Dr. Mihi Park, NUS SingaporeMany language classrooms have become vibrant spaces of linguistic diversity, presenting opportunities and challenges to traditional language instruction. Recognising this potential, language instructors are reimagining course design through the lens of pedagogical translanguaging. In this webinar, I will share a compelling narrative of how translanguaging can create meaningful bridges between existing and new knowledge. This approach encourages students to view language not as a rigid system, but as a fluid, interconnected resource.Register at https://bit.ly/nyuad-lmss
